| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | "I met a traveller from an antique land Who said: Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. Near them on the sand, Half sunk, a shatter'd visage lies, whose frown And wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command Tell that its sculptor well those passions read Which yet survive, stamp'd on these lifeless things, The hand that mock'd them and the heart that fed. And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains: round the decay Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare, The lone and level sands stretch far away.-Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Ozymandias". 1818. |

**Statues** can be found all throughout the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"). Most of them are harmless, but some contain dangerous traps or actively try to kill you. While each kind of statue behaves in a unique way, they are most easily divided into inanimate statues (which are treated like [dungeon features](/Dungeon_features "Dungeon features")) and animated statue monsters (which will attack you and can be "killed"). Whether animate or not, all statues are completely [stationary](/Stationary "Stationary"), and if a statue is capable of attacking you, the game will auto-exclude all tiles in their [LOS](/LOS "LOS") to keep you from accidentally wandering into danger.

All statues behave much like transparent walls, being a barrier to ranged attacks but not visibility; unlike transparent walls, they are *not* a barrier to [reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") or [smite](/Smite "Smite")-targeted attacks. Remember that statues are stationary, so even if you are forced to retreat, you may come back and try again to destroy one after you've healed.

## Contents

- [1 Inanimate Statues](#Inanimate_Statues)
- [2 Monster Statues](#Monster_Statues)
  - [2.1 Unique Statues](#Unique_Statues)
- [3 Retired Statues](#Retired_Statues)
- [4 Other immobile monsters](#Other_immobile_monsters)
- [5 History](#History)

## Inanimate Statues

Inanimate statues, while unaffected by physical attacks, are susceptible to [wands of digging](/Wands_of_digging "Wands of digging") and [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter").

- **Granite statues** come in a variety of shapes, often resembling dangerous monsters, but pose no risk; at worst they may prevent you from reaching a [shop](/Shop "Shop") or pile of treasure.

> A stone statue whose features have long since withered away.

- [![Gravestone.png](/images/0/01/Gravestone.png)](/File:Gravestone.png) **Gravestones** are generally found in special vaults or [portal](/Portal "Portal") levels (like [Zonguldrok's Shrine](/Zonguldrok%27s_Shrine "Zonguldrok's Shrine")). If they show up in the main dungeon, it's a sure sign that the [undead](/Undead "Undead") are wandering the level.

> A nameless grave.

- [![Orcish idol.png](/images/8/8b/Orcish_idol.png)](/File:Orcish_idol.png) **[Orcish idols](/Orcish_idol "Orcish idol")** are like granite statues but are dedicated to the [orc](/Orc "Orc") god [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh").

> An idol of the orc god Beogh.

- [![Broken pillar 1.png](/images/a/ac/Broken_pillar_1.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_1.png) [![Broken pillar 2.png](/images/8/8d/Broken_pillar_2.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_2.png) [![Broken pillar 3.png](/images/e/ee/Broken_pillar_3.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_3.png) [![Broken pillar 4.png](/images/b/be/Broken_pillar_4.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_4.png) [![Broken pillar 5.png](/images/2/29/Broken_pillar_5.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_5.png) [![Broken pillar 6.png](/images/6/6d/Broken_pillar_6.png)](/File:Broken_pillar_6.png) **Broken pillars** are decorative, but no different than regular statues.

> A ruined and crumbled stone pillar.

- [![Golden statue.png](/images/c/c6/Golden_statue.png)](/File:Golden_statue.png) [![Golden statue 2.png](/images/7/71/Golden_statue_2.png)](/File:Golden_statue_2.png) **Golden statues** can be found in some vaults, most often ones containing an [altar](/Altar "Altar") to [Gozag Ym Sagoz](/Gozag_Ym_Sagoz "Gozag Ym Sagoz"). They are otherwise indistinguishable from granite statues.

> A solid gold statue of a saint.

- [![Sarcophagus.png](/images/6/69/Sarcophagus.png)](/File:Sarcophagus.png) **Sarcophagi** can be found in [The Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb"), [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), and certain special levels. Normally, they behave like granite statues. One of the Crypt arrival vaults, **grunt\_crypt\_arrival\_guarded\_gate**, has sarcophagi that release monsters, swarming unsuspecting players.

> An ancient sarcophagus.  
> It appears to be empty. OR It is sealed shut.

- [![Elephant statue.png](/images/c/c6/Elephant_statue.png)](/File:Elephant_statue.png) **Elephant-shaped statues** are inanimate lumps of stone occasionally found in the temple on the bottom floor of the [Lair](/Lair "Lair"). They do nothing until you kill the [anaconda](/Anaconda "Anaconda") in the back of the temple, at which point several of them will come to life and attack you as [dire elephants](/Dire_elephant "Dire elephant"). Be sure to close [doors](/Door "Door") behind you as you explore; this will ensure you only face a few of them at a time.

> This worn granite statue depicts an elephant standing guard.

- **Ruined idols** are scattered around the few remaining structures in the [Desolation of Salt](/Desolation_of_Salt "Desolation of Salt"). They are otherwise identical to granite statues.

> A monument to the glory of a dead god. The statue has been methodically defaced; not a single distinguishing feature remains.

> A statue of an ancient warrior, festooned with trophies from fallen victims. Some dark substance oozes from the gaps in its visor; surely it must be oil...?

- [![Disco ball.png](/images/2/20/Disco_ball.png)](/File:Disco_ball.png) An indestructible **weirdly glowing ball** can be found in a disco-themed [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium") vault.

> A floating ball radiating with shimmering light.

## Monster Statues

Hostile statues are rare, and most are often found as part of a [vault](/Vault "Vault"). Most animate statues have considerable elemental resistance and/or immunity as well as complete immunity to magical effects. All can be worn down by physical damage from weapons or spells like [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot") or [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction"); as they are made of brittle substances, [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction") and [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter") are particularly effective.

8 [![Pillar of salt.png](/images/3/37/Pillar_of_salt.png)](/File:Pillar_of_salt.png) **[Pillar of salt](/Pillar_of_salt "Pillar of salt")**- The consecrated remains of an unfortunate demon or undead that suffered the wrath of [Zin](/Zin "Zin"). Will crumble to nothing shortly.

8 [![Block of ice.png](/images/8/89/Block_of_ice.png)](/File:Block_of_ice.png) **[Block of ice](/Block_of_ice "Block of ice")**- All that's left of a hapless creature that got in the way of a [Glaciate](/Glaciate "Glaciate") or [Absolute Zero](/Absolute_Zero "Absolute Zero") spell; it will melt away in short order.

8 [![Training dummy.png](/images/4/41/Training_dummy.png)](/File:Training_dummy.png) **[Training dummy](/Training_dummy "Training dummy")**- A weak, fragile statue found only in the [Tutorial](/Tutorial "Tutorial") and a few vaults.

8 [![Charred statue.png](/images/f/f3/Charred_statue.png)](/File:Charred_statue.png) **[Charred statue](/Charred_statue "Charred statue")**- A statue that guards an altar to [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet"). Casts [Throw Flame](/Throw_Flame "Throw Flame").

8 [![Frost-covered statue.png](/images/4/47/Frost-covered_statue.png)](/File:Frost-covered_statue.png) **[Frost-covered statue](/Frost-covered_statue "Frost-covered statue")**- A statue that guards an altar to Vehumet. Casts [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost").

8 [![Lightning spire.png](/images/5/5f/Lightning_spire.png)](/File:Lightning_spire.png) **[Lightning spire](/Lightning_spire "Lightning spire")**- An arcane construct that hurls bolts of lightning at passersby. Can be summoned with [Summon Lightning Spire](/Summon_Lightning_Spire "Summon Lightning Spire").

8 [![Ice statue.png](/images/4/49/Ice_statue.png)](/File:Ice_statue.png) **[Ice statue](/Ice_statue "Ice statue")**- Commonly found in [Ice Caves](/Ice_Cave "Ice Cave"), these frozen sculptures summon [ice beasts](/Ice_beast "Ice beast") and hurl powerful blasts of ice. Vulnerable to fire.

8 [![Orange crystal statue.png](/images/1/12/Orange_crystal_statue.png)](/File:Orange_crystal_statue.png) **[Orange crystal statue](/Orange_crystal_statue "Orange crystal statue")**- These dangerous statues [summon a variety of creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures") while keeping up a psychic assault.

8 [![Obsidian statue.png](/images/a/a0/Obsidian_statue.png)](/File:Obsidian_statue.png) **[Obsidian statue](/Obsidian_statue "Obsidian statue")**- These statues [mesmerize](/Mesmerize "Mesmerize") unfortunate travelers while summoning low-to-mid tier demons.

8 [![Warrior statue.png](/images/8/8c/Warrior_statue.png)](/File:Warrior_statue.png) **[Warrior statue](/Warrior_statue "Warrior statue")**- A statue armed with a melee weapon. Its builders placed it in a location where intruders are forced to walk past it.

8 [![Lasher statue.png](/images/a/a8/Lasher_statue.png)](/File:Lasher_statue.png) **[Lasher statue](/Lasher_statue "Lasher statue")**- [Whip](/Whip "Whip")-wielding statues found in narrow hallways.

8 [![Archer statue.png](/images/6/64/Archer_statue.png)](/File:Archer_statue.png) **[Archer statue](/Archer_statue "Archer statue")**- Statues armed with [bows](/Bow "Bow") or [longbows](/Longbow "Longbow") and a generous supply of arrows. Often located behind [bushes](/Bush "Bush").

8 [![Conjurer statue.png](/images/f/f5/Conjurer_statue.png)](/File:Conjurer_statue.png) **[Conjurer statue](/Conjurer_statue "Conjurer statue")**- Magical guardian statues that hurl [Orbs of Destruction](/Orbs_of_Destruction "Orbs of Destruction").

8 [![Wizard statue.png](/images/9/9d/Wizard_statue.png)](/File:Wizard_statue.png) **[Wizard statue](/Wizard_statue "Wizard statue")**- Arcane statues that cast a variety of powerful spells.

8 [![Zot statue.png](/images/b/be/Zot_statue.png)](/File:Zot_statue.png) **[Zot statue](/Zot_statue "Zot statue")**- Brutal statues found only in [Dungeon Sprint](/Dungeon_Sprint "Dungeon Sprint"). They summon in creatures found among the worst of the worst.

8 [![Diamond obelisk.png](/images/2/29/Diamond_obelisk.png)](/File:Diamond_obelisk.png) **[Diamond obelisk](/Diamond_obelisk "Diamond obelisk")**- Surrounded by a constant [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado"), these solid pieces of diamond are virtually indestructible.

### Unique Statues

8 [![Roxanne.png](/images/4/4f/Roxanne.png)](/File:Roxanne.png) **[Roxanne](/Roxanne "Roxanne")**- An [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist") who accidentally turned herself into a statue. She forces her opponents to [blink into range](/Blink_Other_Close "Blink Other Close") of her powerful spells.

8 [![Wucad mu statue.png](/images/4/41/Wucad_mu_statue.png)](/File:Wucad_mu_statue.png) **The [Statue of Wucad Mu](/Wucad_Mu%27s_Monastery#Statue_of_Wucad_Mu "Wucad Mu's Monastery")** - An [orange crystal statue](/Orange_crystal_statue "Orange crystal statue") carved into the likeness of the famed monk and placed in the center of his monastery. Destroying it stems the flood of ghostly monks assaulting you.

8 [![Zot statue.png](/images/b/be/Zot_statue.png)](/File:Zot_statue.png) **[Lunar Statue](/Lehudib%27s_Moon_Base#Subguardians "Lehudib's Moon Base")** - A statue set to guard a rare and powerful item in Lehudib's Moon Base. Similar to an orange crystal statue, but also has [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear") and casts far more often.

## Retired Statues

8 [![Firespitter statue.png](/images/4/46/Firespitter_statue.png)](/File:Firespitter_statue.png) **[Firespitter statue](/Firespitter_statue "Firespitter statue")**- Fire-spewing statues found guarding treasure vaults in [Volcanoes](/Volcano "Volcano"). Removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").

8 [![Silver statue.png](/images/4/4f/Silver_statue.png)](/File:Silver_statue.png) **[Silver statue](/Silver_statue "Silver statue")**- Statues that summoned a variety of [demons](/Demon "Demon"). Replaced by [obsidian statues](/Obsidian_statue "Obsidian statue") in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").

8 [![Snail statue.png](/images/d/d3/Snail_statue.png)](/File:Snail_statue.png) **[Snail statue](/Snail_statue "Snail statue")**- An idol of [Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados") that would repeatedly cast [Leda's Liquefaction](/Leda%27s_Liquefaction "Leda's Liquefaction"). Removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").

8 [![Spooky statue.png](/images/b/bf/Spooky_statue.png)](/File:Spooky_statue.png) **[Spooky statue](/Spooky_statue "Spooky statue")** - Eerie statues that guarded certain vaults in [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"). Their presence [summoned ghosts](/Haunt "Haunt") to attack intruders. Removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").

## Other immobile monsters

Certain types of plants are immobile and may create movement exclusion zones when discovered, but unlike statues, they are not [nonliving](/Nonliving "Nonliving"). See [list of plants](/List_of_plants "List of plants") for more details.

## History

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), statues couldn't regenerate [HP](/HP "HP").
- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction") could destroy mundane statues.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), [wands of disintegration](/Wand_of_disintegration "Wand of disintegration") and [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction") could destroy mundane statues; [wands of digging](/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") had no effect.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), statues weren't stabbable; obsidian & orange crystal statues had no sInv. Also, destroying orcish idols had a chance of causing Beogh to smite you.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), some hostile statues could be destroyed instantly with a wand of disintegration.

Previous versions had "scorch marked granite statues", which were statues in areas that would perpetually generate flame [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"). The vaults containing the statues are still present, but the statues themselves are no longer distinguishable from other statues.

  • Prior to 0.19, statues weren't stabbable; obsidian & orange crystal statues had no sInv. Also, destroying orcish idols had a chance of causing Beogh to smite you.
  • Prior to 0.15, some hostile statues could be destroyed instantly with a wand of disintegration.

Previous versions had "scorch marked granite statues", which were statues in areas that would perpetually generate flame clouds. The vaults containing the statues are still present, but the statues themselves are no longer distinguishable from other statues.

{{version026}} {{flavour|"I met a traveller from an antique land
Who said: Two vast and trunkless legs of stone
Stand in the desert. Near them on the sand,
Half sunk, a shatter'd visage lies, whose frown
And wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command
Tell that its sculptor well those passions read
Which yet survive, stamp'd on these lifeless things,
The hand that mock'd them and the heart that fed.
And on the pedestal these words appear:
'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings:
Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!'
Nothing beside remains: round the decay
Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare,
The lone and level sands stretch far away. -Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Ozymandias". 1818.}} '''Statues''' can be found all throughout the [[Dungeon]]. Most of them are harmless, but some contain dangerous traps or actively try to kill you. While each kind of statue behaves in a unique way, they are most easily divided into inanimate statues (which are treated like [[dungeon features]]) and animated statue monsters (which will attack you and can be "killed"). Whether animate or not, all statues are completely [[stationary]], and if a statue is capable of attacking you, the game will auto-exclude all tiles in their [[LOS]] to keep you from accidentally wandering into danger. All statues behave much like transparent walls, being a barrier to ranged attacks but not visibility; unlike transparent walls, they are ''not'' a barrier to [[reaching]] or [[smite]]-targeted attacks. Remember that statues are stationary, so even if you are forced to retreat, you may come back and try again to destroy one after you've healed. ==Inanimate Statues== Inanimate statues, while unaffected by physical attacks, are susceptible to [[wands of digging]] and [[Shatter]]. *'''Granite statues''' come in a variety of shapes, often resembling dangerous monsters, but pose no risk; at worst they may prevent you from reaching a [[shop]] or pile of treasure. {{crawlquote|A stone statue whose features have long since withered away.}} {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:auto; padding:0; text-align: center" | [[File:Statue ancient evil.png]] || [[File:Statue ancient hero.png]] || [[File:Statue angel.png]] || [[File:Statue archer.png]] || [[File:Statue axe.png]] || [[File:Statue cat.png]] || [[File:Statue centaur.png]] || [[File:Statue cerebov.png]] || [[File:Statue demonic bust.png]] || [[File:Statue dragon.png]] |- | [[File:Statue dwarf.png]] || [[File:Statue elephant.png]] || [[File:Statue hydra.png]] || [[File:Statue imp.png]] || [[File:Statue maw.png]] || [[File:Statue mermaid.png]] || [[File:Statue naga.png]] || [[File:Statue orb.png]] || [[File:Statue orb guardian.png]] || [[File:Statue polearm.png]] |- | [[File:Statue princess.png]] || [[File:Statue sigmund.png]] || [[File:Statue snail.png]] || [[File:Statue sword.png]] || [[File:Statue tengu.png]] || [[File:Statue tentacles.png]] || [[File:Statue triangle.png]] || [[File:Statue twins.png]] || [[File:Statue wraith.png]] |} *[[File:gravestone.png]] '''Gravestones''' are generally found in special vaults or [[portal]] levels (like [[Zonguldrok's Shrine]]). If they show up in the main dungeon, it's a sure sign that the [[undead]] are wandering the level. {{crawlquote|A nameless grave.}} *[[File:Orcish idol.png]] '''[[Orcish idol]]s''' are like granite statues but are dedicated to the [[orc]] god [[Beogh]]. {{crawlquote|An idol of the orc god Beogh.}} *[[File:Broken pillar 1.png]] [[File:Broken pillar 2.png]] [[File:Broken pillar 3.png]] [[File:Broken pillar 4.png]] [[File:Broken pillar 5.png]] [[File:Broken pillar 6.png]] '''Broken pillars''' are decorative, but no different than regular statues. {{crawlquote|A ruined and crumbled stone pillar.}} *[[File:Golden statue.png]] [[File:Golden statue 2.png]] '''Golden statues''' can be found in some vaults, most often ones containing an [[altar]] to [[Gozag Ym Sagoz]]. They are otherwise indistinguishable from granite statues. {{crawlquote|A solid gold statue of a saint.}} *[[File:Sarcophagus.png]] '''Sarcophagi''' can be found in [[The Tomb]], [[The Crypt]], and certain special levels. Normally, they behave like granite statues. One of the Crypt arrival vaults, '''grunt_crypt_arrival_guarded_gate''', has sarcophagi that release monsters, swarming unsuspecting players. {{crawlquote|An ancient sarcophagus.
It appears to be empty. OR It is sealed shut.}} *[[File:Elephant statue.png]] '''Elephant-shaped statues''' are inanimate lumps of stone occasionally found in the temple on the bottom floor of the [[Lair]]. They do nothing until you kill the [[anaconda]] in the back of the temple, at which point several of them will come to life and attack you as [[dire elephant]]s. Be sure to close [[door]]s behind you as you explore; this will ensure you only face a few of them at a time. {{crawlquote|This worn granite statue depicts an elephant standing guard.}} *'''Ruined idols''' are scattered around the few remaining structures in the [[Desolation of Salt]]. They are otherwise identical to granite statues. {{crawlquote|A monument to the glory of a dead god. The statue has been methodically defaced; not a single distinguishing feature remains.}} *[[File:Iron statue.png]] '''Iron statues''' are found only in the [[Iron City of Dis]], but are no different from other statues. {{crawlquote|A statue of an ancient warrior, festooned with trophies from fallen victims. Some dark substance oozes from the gaps in its visor; surely it must be oil...?}} *[[File:Disco ball.png]] An indestructible '''weirdly glowing ball''' can be found in a disco-themed [[Pandemonium]] vault. {{crawlquote|A floating ball radiating with shimmering light.}} ==Monster Statues== Hostile statues are rare, and most are often found as part of a [[vault]]. Most animate statues have considerable elemental resistance and/or immunity as well as complete immunity to magical effects. All can be worn down by physical damage from weapons or spells like [[Iron Shot]] or [[Orb of Destruction]]; as they are made of brittle substances, [[Lee's Rapid Deconstruction]] and [[Shatter]] are particularly effective. {{monsterlink|Pillar of salt}}- The consecrated remains of an unfortunate demon or undead that suffered the wrath of [[Zin]]. Will crumble to nothing shortly. {{monsterlink|Block of ice}}- All that's left of a hapless creature that got in the way of a [[Glaciate]] or [[Absolute Zero]] spell; it will melt away in short order. {{monsterlink|Training dummy}}- A weak, fragile statue found only in the [[Tutorial]] and a few vaults. {{monsterlink|Charred statue}}- A statue that guards an altar to [[Vehumet]]. Casts [[Throw Flame]]. {{monsterlink|Frost-covered statue}}- A statue that guards an altar to Vehumet. Casts [[Throw Frost]]. {{monsterlink|Lightning spire}}- An arcane construct that hurls bolts of lightning at passersby. Can be summoned with [[Summon Lightning Spire]]. {{monsterlink|Ice statue}}- Commonly found in [[Ice Cave]]s, these frozen sculptures summon [[ice beast]]s and hurl powerful blasts of ice. Vulnerable to fire. {{monsterlink|Orange crystal statue}}- These dangerous statues [[Shadow Creatures|summon a variety of creatures]] while keeping up a psychic assault. {{monsterlink|Obsidian statue}}- These statues [[mesmerize]] unfortunate travelers while summoning low-to-mid tier demons. {{monsterlink|Warrior statue}}- A statue armed with a melee weapon. Its builders placed it in a location where intruders are forced to walk past it. {{monsterlink|Lasher statue}}- [[Whip]]-wielding statues found in narrow hallways. {{monsterlink|Archer statue}}- Statues armed with [[bow]]s or [[longbow]]s and a generous supply of arrows. Often located behind [[bush]]es. {{monsterlink|Conjurer statue}}- Magical guardian statues that hurl [[Orbs of Destruction]]. {{monsterlink|Wizard statue}}- Arcane statues that cast a variety of powerful spells. {{monsterlink|Zot statue}}- Brutal statues found only in [[Dungeon Sprint]]. They summon in creatures found among the worst of the worst. {{monsterlink|Diamond obelisk}}- Surrounded by a constant [[Tornado]], these solid pieces of diamond are virtually indestructible. ===Unique Statues=== {{monsterlink|Roxanne}}- An [[Earth Elementalist]] who accidentally turned herself into a statue. She forces her opponents to [[Blink Other Close|blink into range]] of her powerful spells. {{LightRed|8}} [[File:Wucad mu statue.png]] '''The [[Wucad Mu's Monastery#Statue of Wucad Mu|Statue of Wucad Mu]]''' - An [[orange crystal statue]] carved into the likeness of the famed monk and placed in the center of his monastery. Destroying it stems the flood of ghostly monks assaulting you. {{LightMagenta|8}} [[File:Zot statue.png]] '''[[Lehudib's Moon Base#Subguardians|Lunar Statue]]''' - A statue set to guard a rare and powerful item in Lehudib's Moon Base. Similar to an orange crystal statue, but also has [[Lehudib's Crystal Spear]] and casts far more often. ==Retired Statues== {{monsterlink|Firespitter statue}}- Fire-spewing statues found guarding treasure vaults in [[Volcano]]es. Removed in [[0.19]]. {{monsterlink|Silver statue}}- Statues that summoned a variety of [[demon]]s. Replaced by [[obsidian statue]]s in [[0.16]]. {{LightGrey|8}} [[File:Snail statue.png]] '''[[Snail statue]]'''- An idol of [[Cheibriados]] that would repeatedly cast [[Leda's Liquefaction]]. Removed in [[0.13]]. {{LightGrey|8}} [[File:Spooky statue.png]] '''[[Spooky statue]]''' - Eerie statues that guarded certain vaults in [[The Crypt]]. Their presence [[Haunt|summoned ghosts]] to attack intruders. Removed in [[0.13]]. ==Other immobile monsters== Certain types of plants are immobile and may create movement exclusion zones when discovered, but unlike statues, they are not [[nonliving]]. See [[list of plants]] for more details. ==History== *Prior to [[0.26]], statues couldn't regenerate [[HP]]. *Prior to [[0.22]], [[Lee's Rapid Deconstruction]] could destroy mundane statues. *Prior to [[0.20]], [[wand of disintegration|wands of disintegration]] and [[Orb of Destruction]] could destroy mundane statues; [[wand of digging|wands of digging]] had no effect. *Prior to [[0.19]], statues weren't stabbable; obsidian & orange crystal statues had no sInv. Also, destroying orcish idols had a chance of causing Beogh to smite you. *Prior to [[0.15]], some hostile statues could be destroyed instantly with a wand of disintegration. Previous versions had "scorch marked granite statues", which were statues in areas that would perpetually generate flame [[cloud]]s. The vaults containing the statues are still present, but the statues themselves are no longer distinguishable from other statues. [[Category:Lists of monsters]] [[Category:Dungeon Features]]
